review: This is not a terrible Chili's, but it's not terribly great either.  My waitress in the bar area last week was very friendly, very concerned about how I was doing, and it felt genuinely like she was having a good time and not the usual harried employee 'working'.  That makes for a much better experience in my opinion. I've been to this location a dozen times over the years.  Once in a large group, on multiple dates, alone.  Sat next to The Undertaker once.  (The wrestler, seriously!) I'll go back I'm sure.

Totally pedestrian food but the service was better than expected. I was meeting some people here for a lunch meeting (their choice not mine). I ended up getting there 1 hour before them because of a huge traffic accident on 59.  The servers were so nice. They didn't bug me to order, they just checked on me and refilled my drink. When we did order, they were very quick with our food. The club sandwich was fine and better than I expected, but I did have low expectations. The restaurant was clean and the parking was easy. I noticed a lot of business lunch people here, and the turn around on food was fast.   Overall, totally fine and would go again.

I am not a Chili's fan.  This time I went because I was at a conference in the mall.  Needed a seperate ticket so my friend could get reimbursed- they couldn't handle that- we asked THREE times-  "Ok I had a beer, my friend needs a ticket with just HIS food on it, he can't have a beer listed on his ticket- his work won't reimburse him" I just bought his next dinner.   Not to mention the terrible service.  The santa fe salad- not bad.  Blue Moon on draft- thats good too.  With all the options in this food court- I'll avoid this location like the plague.

I like Chili's, but I hate this location. I haven't been to this one in years, and it is because of the crappy service. The last time I was here was with my sister a few years ago. The restaurant was not busy and had been open for less than hour. The hostess seated us, and we sat there for about 15 minutes before we got up and left because our waiter never came. Talk about rude and crappy service.
Boy, I love this Chili's.  This is the best Chili's in Houston.  The food is always fresh and hot.  The staff is always patient, friendly, and fast.  Great Job Guys!!!!!!!

We got the margharita flatbread which was pretty good, and the Guacamole burger with black bean patty instead of meat. We asked for a sesame bun and got wheat instead, which is not a big deal really but when we pointed out the mistake to the waitress she didn't seem to know the difference between wheat and sesame buns.. hmm. The black bean patty was really hard and not very flavourful.... I guess Chili's does not excell at vegetrain fare. Overall, it was an ok experience but I won't be hurrying back any time soon.

My experience here was one of my favorite Chili's experiences. My waitress was super friendly and helpful, going the extra mile to tell us how to take best advantage of their 2 for $20 deal.The food and drinks came out quick and was fresh and hot. We got seated by a window and it was nice to see the landscaping in the patio and the busy Westheimer street traffic.  My favorite Chili's dish is the ribs - its always consistently good.
Dirty tables, unimpressive food and checkered service rob me of any desire to revisit this restaurant chain.
Great place to eat and affordable. We go there for lunch. I work by the galleria so having a nice done in place is always nice. The staff there is always nice and friendly.

Great food and even better service...sit at the bar! I ordered the cajun lime grilled shrimp deliciousness with mashed taters and broccoli. All fresh and tasty even right before closing. Such a cozy location. I will say it again. Sit at the bar!

I can't express how poor of a dining experience we had at this Chili's. We came in for a late lunch after having not eaten all day and ready for any sort of meal. We left wondering how this place even manages to remain in business. The one star is not for the server or the atmosphere. Our waitress was polite and upbeat, and well the atmosphere was typical of any Chili's. The one star is for the completely unsavory and unappetizing dishes we received. It was as if this particular location had given up on its sense of good taste due to its popularity and safe haven amongst the well known brand of the restaurant chain.  We knew what we were getting into but didn't expect it to be that bad. To start off, the soup we ordered lost all of its appeal soon after we started eating. My chili tasted like it came from a can that they didn't even bother to microwave. Her loaded potato soup actually tasted fine for the first few minutes before it congealed into a thick lump of cheese.  The appetizer (artichoke dip) was actually enjoyable, which was a surprise since we were unsure if anything was still palatable after having eaten the soup. The main entrees were a disappointment, however. The bread from our sandwiches were stale; the fries were stale; and I swear at that point, it felt as if even the water was stale. The chicken was under-seasoned and dry. It tasted like a cardboard patty in a cardboard bun. Perhaps everything only tasted that poorly due to our now lost appetite.  If there was a single modicum of good taste, it would belong to the dessert (which I had to beg my GF to try in an effort to salvage such a disappointing meal.) While not the absolutely best, it certainly could have been much worse. The molten cake with the ice cream on top was a nice change of pace in such a pitiful meal.  And they say that hunger was supposed to be the best seasoning; well, I guess we were just not hungry enough. Not even if we had been starving for days.

I'm just going to keep it nice and sweet. Service: Okay Food: Not the best. (Presentation was horrible, the food was cold) Atmosphere: Dirty.    I have been to many Chilis, and I am usually very satisfied... But this one was just a mess! I felt rushed, the food was questionable... I won't be returning here. I rather spend my money somewhere else.

Warning: do not eat here.  Probably OK to drink here (alcohol sterilizes everything). My first time at this location. I ate at the bar since I was alone.  Seemed like a film of grease on everything; not clean.  There were papers strewn all over the bar (old newspapers, napkins, printed papers like receipts, etc.). Bartender was completely uninterested in me as a customer.  During my meal, he failed to bring me water, cheese, extra salad dressing and chopped onions as I requested.  The bartender was in a foul mood.  He smiled at no one and spoke to no one including the manager and waitresses.  Hey, I don't like my job either but I don't punish the customers or my co-workers.  The manager frequently appeared behind the bar and spoke very LOUD!  His best story was that he was going to fire Cody the next time he came in because Cody was diddling one of the waitresses on the job (Cody: if you read this before your next shift, no need to return). Then the manager and bartender proceeded to tear bar equipment apart.  They had no tools and as far as I could ascertain, no skills either.  Cue sweating, pushing, shoving, grunting, etc. The food was substandard.  I ordered a bowl of chili (their namesake, right?); it was poor.  Tasted like it had been prepared last week and microwaved just before they plopped it in front of me.  Very stale.  Side salad was OK; at least it looked and tasted fresh.  Not much of it on a small plate. I seldom rate one star reviews and only if deserved. Will NEVER go back to this Chili's location.  May never go to another Chili's.

This place gets a 3, but it's not all their fault. The food was solid, not fantastic, but it was Chili's and it was good for Chili's food.  My dessert was delicious.  A cookie in a skillet with ice cream on top.  Man that was good. The place gets 3 stars for 2 reasons. 1.  Scummy clientele.  Not so much the restaurant's fault, but I grade on my experience at the place I go and too many scummy families letting their kids scream and run around, kick my chair, and scream and run around.  If my waiter would have called out the scum parents he could have done himself a favor with me. 2.  Lying Ziosk.  They put these things at everyone's table called Ziosks, google it and you can read more.  You can pay money to play games (babysit your child, like I wish these 2 sets of scummy parents did), you can order dessert, and you can pay your bill.   Me and my wife's bill was 29.95.  It asked me how much I wanted to tip.  I generally tip 15% and this ziosk tried to convince me that 15% of $29.95 was 5.20.  That is false.  15% of 30 is $4.50 and I immediately identified this.  I gave my waiter (solid not great) his 15% (which is tried to tell me was 13.8%), but due to the fact that they attempted to lie to me with these false tipping ziosks I have no intention of going back.   Steal and lie to someone else and cater to scumbag families, I'm done.
Ordered to go and it was the sourthern smokehouse and chile glazed chicken.  Food was okay.  Can't comment on in restaurant experience as this was for to go.

I have been coming here for a awhile as I am more of bar beer person. When I first started coming here, things were great. But until about the last 9 months it starts to get to pretty bad and rowdy in the bar area. Considering it is still is a restaurant. There are always these same people that goes there and plays loud music. Music which not everyone even wants to hear. If I want to go listen to music I'd be at a regular bar and play the jukebox. Also avoid going there where there is a BIG beard guy works there. He's the worse. So I've stopped going there and taken my business to Pappadueux Seafood Kitchen which is a lot nicer and more relaxed.

Horrible, horrible, horrible! I ordered fajitas to-go and when I arrived at the restaurant 20 mins later my order had not even been started. I could see directly into the kitchen, which was dirty. I waited for 12 mins while they made my order. The waitress brought it out and nicely opened the box for me to see. The chicken looked boiled and the onions were barely cooked. I asked her to please have the kitchen cook a bit longer.  Only plus was the super nice hostess. Wish I knew her name to give her props.

Had the lunch combo double. Excellent value for the price. Wonderful flavor. Had Charles for our  server; excellent experience. I'll ask for him the next time I come in. They have an auto checkout, ziosk, that make it easy to pay and leave.

Avoid if going there late!!!!! Place closes at 11pm I arrived at 10:40 the waiter that greeted us was rude.. While we are waiting for him to seat us he was chitchatting with another employee from the bar and just flying the word I'm cooked bar is cooked when the waiter offered to sit us at the bar. We wanted a both. Surprisingly the waiter took us back to the waiting area after reaching the booth cause it had two glasses on it and a tray. He picked the tray and asked us to wait while someone come and clean the table and take the two glasses knowing that there was few empty booths at the end!!. I know we came in late but no reason for the. Attitude and just being lazy. Doubt I will be heading to that chili's at night ever again

not a whole lot I can say about this Chili's. I mean, it's a Chili's, you can expect pretty much the kind of service and food that you would expect at a Chili's. The waiters at this location definitely did not make an attempt to make my experience there more enjoyable nor did they suck. I haven't dined at any Chili's location in a while, so I'm not sure if all Chili's locations have this little screen at every dining table. You can look at the food menu, drink menu, order desserts, and even pay for your tab. This little device pretty much rendered the wait staff kind of useless. And this is exactly what I mean when I said that our waiter didn't really try to wow me. He was barely there. I usually get the chicken crispers when I dine at Chili's. However, the last couple of times, my meal had come with corn in a little bowl instead of corn on the cob. I used to LOVE the flavor of Chili's corn on the cob, but the corn in the bowl doesn't have that distinctive delicious Chili's flavor. Yeah, I'll dine here when I'm craving Chili's and so will you. But obviously, don't expect anything to be super duper amazing.

AWFUL!!! Wife and I ordered margaritas and chips and salsa. Appetizer arrives in a few min. We don't have drinks so we asked for waters too. 15 min goes by, no drinks. There was maximum of 10-15 people in the restaurant. Bartender is watching tv and talking to the 4 people at the bar. 30 min goes by no drinks. The server has told them 3-4 times he needs the drinks for the table. 45 min goes by, bartender starts making our drinks. (While talking to the people at the bar and watching tv) 10 min later we get our drinks. The sugar has ROTTON ORANGE PEAL in it. ( little orange/brown dots around the rim along with sugar not just a few ALOT!). Wife didn't drink hers, I tasted it there wasn't any alcohol. I drank my patron margarita, as well doesn't have any alcohol. Server comes by and tells us that the manager apologizes and she will remove our chips and salsa. WHAT?! Tell her to come here! She comes and tells us how busy he has been?!? My wife said, "I CAN SEE HIM! HAS BEEN WATCHING TV AND TALKING TO THE PEOPLE AT THE BAR! She continued to take up for her staff, even though my wife could see them. My wife was furious, she told me in front of her, " this better be on the house or we need to get the $&@" out of here! The manager took the drinks off finally after arguing with us for 10 min. BY FAR THE WORST CHILIS I HAVE BEEN TO!!!! WE DIDNT ORDER FOOD, EVEN THOUGH WE WERE GOING THERE TO EAT!!!!!

Beer on the patio?  Don't mind if I do.  My waiter was really nice and it made me want to order everything on the menu LOL.  I tried something new and got a light meal. The salmon was good, a little dry but flavorful nonetheless

They deleted my review right after I published it on their website. I came in with my son and ex husband after his long flight from Paris at around 11 pm. We chose Chillis because my eight year old son loves Chillis. There were many empty, clean tables yet we were told we had to wait 15 minutes. The food took forever to come out. Funny how at all the other Chillis I've been to they're always packed yet they get your food out fast and you receive spectacular service. I have had wonderful experiences at the Lake Jackson, Katy, Sugar Land, Clear Lake, Pearland and Webster locations, but not at the 77057 location. The waitress asked my table if we needed anything and I said I had no water. She rudely stated I just had to ask for water. I've never had a waitress be rude to me and I'm almost forty years old nor have I ever complained at a restaurant or received bad service. I asked for the manager because there's no way a waitress is getting belligerent with me. The manager Sean or Shawn (not sure how he spells his name) comes out and is even more rude than the waitress and unkept. My son said both him and our waitress ruined his appetite and ran to get a card from the front that has the real manager's info on it. I will be calling her on Monday. To top it off my son said the waitress made an obscene hand gesture in my face. Thank goodness my head was turned and he waited till we got in the car to tell me. Absolutely unacceptable on all levels. I would never eat here again. The food was not up to par either like other Chillis. Just because it's not Eddy V's or Perry's Steakhouse doesn't make it okay to treat a sweet customer like me or any customer for that matter that way. What's sad is that on the way home we saw two Mediterranean restaurants that are wonderful and were still open so we could of saved ourselves from such a nightmare experience.

Walked in hostess was super rude. We sat at the table for a while before anyone took our drink order. The person to come to the table wasn't even our server I'm assuming he was he manager. Our server didn't actually show up until much later and said "oh are you guys ready to order or do you need more time?" Oh no we've just been sitting here for almost 30 minutes but we need more time. After we ordered the food took FOREVER so long that we just left. We were there for an hour -_-.....oh and in case I didn't mention it was ridiculously slow in there. Won't go there ever again. And I don't recommend it.

Carlos was awesome! I ordered queso to go & the chips were all crunched up, so I asked for some new ones. But as I'm leaving I forget to wait for my new chips. He runs all the way outside just to tell me I forgot them. I can only imagine how many other people would have been like "oh well, not my problem "  Kudos to Carlos!!

Very slow services since we got there - we had to wait for 8 min for the receptionist to show up at the front desk. Where she didn't apologize claiming that she was getting some menus from inside. And she was so rude when we asked here if they can have a ringer for incomers. The waitress was OK but the whole place was weird with no smile on their faces and We are still waiting for the food hopefully it would be at least the only good thing in here. Never again.
Worse service ALL AROUND. Stood there to be seated.. Took forever, sat down on the table.. No One greeting.... Got up and left.. The hostess didnt even say a damn word.. F***ing awesome service.

Place is not a bad place to eat but was check out for your cars in the parking lot. My boyfriend was there yesterday to grab something to eat after buying some toys for his niece and nephew at the toysrus next to this location and someone cut out the lock ok his door and ransacked his truck.

My husband and I  love this Chili's! They're always so attentive and friendly, even when they're busy. We love the new rewards system that makes coming here often even more affordable. We've never eaten anything here that we didn't enjoy. Hats off to the chef

If you sit in the bar Tony and Thomas are great! The food is good reliable chili's food. The new happy hour is awesome!!! In the dining area ask for Missy during the day. Only thing I don't like is the "To Go" people hover and lurk in the bar area. Management needs to stop being cheap and pay someone to handle To Go.  The baretender should not get below minimum wage and have to do two jobs. It is not fair to the customers that are actually in the bar. And most To Go customers do not tip. Servers live off their tips people, they do not get "minimum wage" they get $2.35 an hour which is eaten up by taxes.  If you can't afford to tip, here's a tip, stay home and have a Hot Pocket.

I don't normally post reviews, but this is the worst Chili's. My fiancé went in to pick up an order. He called ahead about 30 mins before coming into the restaurant. He waited 15 minutes for someone to come help him. After that he waited another 15 minutes, only to find out they didn't have all the pieces to the order. The manager thought he could give him an extra cookie in Lieu of ice cream and charge him full price. This is a horrible place. He should have told us that part of our order was not available. Management is poor and I will never be back! Such a shame because this Chili's is so close to my apartment.

This Chili's is not great. The service was slow and the waiters were not very attentive. The food is hit or miss at best. We got a turkey burger that had no seasoning and it was rubbery. You could tell it was not fresh. I won't be back.

My coupon email account gets flooded with offers, at least two per week. They usually send coupons for a free appetizer, dessert or kid's meal so this is the go to spot for a date night with my son. It's located right across the parking lot from Toys R Us, which is a win for him. Staff has been below average on every single visit. I once had to go and get my own straw and silverware. Why don't the servers know things like that detract from the tip? SMH. As long as I can flag down the server for a refill when needed, it's not a huge deal since I just want a quiet dinner with my son, and he's very easy to please.  I like their rewards system. I get s free item every time I visit. You should definitely join even if you don't go frequently. I think you get 60 points just for joining, which is enough for a free appetizer.

The only reason me and my boyfriend keep coming to this chilis is because is the only one close to us. The food is good, but the service is HORRIBLE! there is ALWAYS a wait time to be seated when there is a lot of table opens and many waitress... GOOD FOOD, HORRIBLE SERVICE!

I came here with a friend to have few drinks and a bite to eat. I ordered shots of tequila for myself. My friend ordered the med well steak. I was served gin not once but twice and when I asked the bartender archie about it. It told me he had been knowingly serving me gin not tequila. There was nothing done to fix the situation. Considering gin makes me sick. My friend steak came out well done and not medium well. This is some of the worst service that I have received from a kitchen as well as a bartender. I will never go back again. Period.

The low star rating is based on service here. We placed an order online for two Boneless Buffalo Chicken Salad and went to pick up. When we got there, the restaurant looked pretty empty, so I was thinking this should be a quick in and out trip especially since all we ordered were two salads. Boy was I wrong. Despite the lack of people dining there, the staff took their sweet time getting to us. We managed to wait at least 15 minutes before getting out food and leaving. I had even timed it because I didn't want to leave the house too late in case the food was already prepped and waiting for us to pick up. In the end, that didn't matter because there was still a wait no matter what. By the time we were able to eat our food, it wasn't as fresh as I would hope, but I have always liked the food at Chili's. I had asked for avocado in my salad and the avocado slices were not all fresh either as some of the slices were brown.

Worst service ever.... Ordered my steak well done got medium rare. Sent it back. The brought back same cut off steak all dry up. All my sides were cold by the time the steak made it back, toast was burned. Manager said they allow for food the touches the table to go back to the kitchen. That's just wrong I work in the restaurant industry and  I would never allow this type of service toward my guest. I used to visit this Chili's often no more lost a customer for life.
Now I remember why I stopped eating here years ago! The service and food was horrible! It tasted like frozen food that was microwaved.

I've been to a ton of chilis across the states and they are all really consistent. The food is tastey and the prices don't leave you feeling robbed after you have a night out! This chilis didn't disappoint. When we first walked in we noticed it was a little smaller than most chilis. The bar was busy, but seats were available. Out server greeted us quickly and reminded us of the happy hour!! Happy hour here is AWESOME!!!! Tons of your favorites drinks and snacks all under $6. We ordered long islands and they were delicious, strong. My honey chipotle crispers came out perfect as usual and my corn and fries were the cherry on top. Food was a knockout. Service from Thomas (our server) was attentive and speedy! The food came out quick and hot! The drink were cheap and strong! If you're looking for a new happy hour spot with consistently delicious food. Chilis is the place for you!!!
Love this chilis. It's easy, quick, food is good and the service is on point. One of our go to take out spots too!!

Sodium explosion! This was at one time one of my favs but through the years the food has gone downhill. Ordered from the lunch menu, chicken enchilada soup, the chicken is the mechanically separated diced fake stuff, flavor was so salty you could not distinguish anything else, hubs thought the same about the potato soup. Paired the soup with BLT on pretzel bun, bun was very tough, with a few slimed shred in the lettuce. Cheap eats but won't be back. Good bye Chili's
took 20 minutes to get chicken strips. service is not good. there was 1 server for 15 people.

Ok so I'm currently here waiting for my order that was placed early 8pm. It's now 8:57 and the order was suppose to be here 8:32. Moreover, the to go register said to go to the bar to pick up your order. I'm seating on an empty table and it's packed. Payment has not been taken yet even though he confirmed my name for the order. Last time I'm coming here!

CRAPP SERVICE sums it up. I asked for a table for one from the rude unwelcoming hostess. I was told to wait. waited and waited and waited forever even though people came after me and were seated. I saw the stupid hostess talking to another co worker and looking at me...If you have something to say b++++ come and ask me, after like 30 minutes waiting...guess what? she asked me "How could I help you?" Wow, really? I mean what WTF" I gritted my teeth and let that slide. I was seated just to be left there for like another 15 minutes, no waiter showed up or any one came just to ask if I wanted to drink something. I just walked out while the stupid hostess's eyes escort me leaving not saying a single word. Perfect service Chillies

Been here for five minutes, sat down and no one greeted us. When we were greater it took 5 more minutes just for water while the bartenders were just talking and doing nothing do get our order or water. Don't get my wrong I love chilis and the food but this location needs to train them on customer service and timing. Very disappointed and will never go to this location again.

I ended up here,  wow - it's been a long time since I've been here. The decor was modern,  orange, brown and mustard. Too much orange, think Burger King. We ordered quickly after being seated. I did not know they had 2 types of queso,  and a new BBQ platter. I ordered the jalapeño and cheese sausage and ribs, corn on the cobb, macaroni cheese with jalapeños, seasoned bread and pickles as a garnish for $17.  My daughter had the 3 for $10 , chips and salsa, 1/2 rack of ribs, with fries and molten chocolate cake. The only downside was the length of time for the food to come out, lucky we had the chips, but I couldn't eat  most of my food. Overall,  impressed with the seasoning on my food, maybe it was just a very good night.

I love this Chili's for happy hour. Archie the bartender is awesome.  He is so friendly and made me feel so welcomed amongst the regulars.  The food was great and the beers were ice cold.  Love the new craft beer selection.  May make this a new place to hang out for drinks and fun!
Tony my man at the bar ftw! He rocks and makes the best moltens Ask for him. He is always cheery and makea great drinks too! Love himmmmmmmmm!!

Omg!!!!! I have never ever experienced the worst service ever.!'!!! Beginning from the hostess,waitress and others suppose to be about team work... it was just sad... Our food took more than enough time to be received at least warm... (45mins)... never again.. thanks but no thanks...
Horrible service late at night. Don't let folks sit if you're just gonna act like a blind sloth: acting like you don't see us for over 15min, then taking forever to do anything to help us.
I came here on Mother's Day to bring my mom . Chili's has really changed there menu dramatically lol !! The atmosphere and the food was really good . Honestly I can't complain

Wondering why is it that I can't give this place a ZERO star rating?  Worst service ever! I asked for a beer and got a different one. My party of 3 adults and 2 toddlers waited for about 45 minutes for 2 cheeseburgers and a fajita plata. I asked the server DANIEL, if the order would be ready soon, to what he reply " let me check.." he never came back. By now, a solid 1 hour had passed, we run out of water, no one ever stopped by to let us know our order was in the works but it would take a little longer than anticipated... my 2 year old started getting fuzzy and annoyed, my wife hadn't eat yet all day, and my one month old baby was being fed. All while no one checked on us.  I got up, put $7.00 under my beer bottle and walked out of this restaurant. I will never eat again at this place. It's a waste of time, money, and desire to  dine out. Go to jack in the box, you'll get better services  through the drive thru. The manager needs to start addressing this issues soon, or else their career as restaurant manager compromises the integrity of many other chain restaurants.

A friend of mine and me sat at the bar for a quick beer and lunch while running errands, and the bartender Sam was very knowledgable and super sweet! Got our drinks quick, and the food came out very shortly after!

Don't eat here they are running a scam! Stole money off my card. I gave the guy a nice cash tip.Then when he ran my card the amount I was suppose to pay said it on the receipt. But when I left and I got the alert from the bank it said a different amount. In the process of my complaint with corporate now.

Bad service, decent food. This one is near home so we have been a handful of times, and they never have enough staff to be attentive or get us seated in a timely manner. There is always a fifteen minute wait even when the place is quiet and not busy.  Today was the last straw. Our server only looked at my boyfriend and I once or twice throughout our entire time dining. Most of the time he had his neck cranked back, watching the football game, making comments about it. He got our order wrong because he was on auto pilot and assumed we wanted a steak with grilled avocado on the side instead of the steak and avocado entree which has different elements to it (like tomatoes and sauce.) The way he rang it up also cost us more money. The food that we got was good. The steaks were the right temperature and everything else was good. I wanted to leave a review, but their self pay kiosk was down because of hurricane Harvey aftermath. I would recommend if you want this type of food to go to an Applebee's nearby instead. The bad service isn't worth the decent food. We personally won't be back.

Black bean burger and fries were great. The problem was that they brought the wrong dish out for my daughter. Arrived and waited 30 minutes for food to come out in a generally unpopulated restaurant. When food arrived, it was incorrect. Was supposed to be steak and salad from the healthy grill section, and I had to clarify that it was a different order. Waitress once again messed up the order, forgetting the avocado. Stated it would be rushed, three dishes came out for other customers  in the time we waited. It didn't come out til I had finished my burger. They just put the steak under the hot lamp and as a result it was over cooked. Aggressively mediocre at best just due to pure incompetence.

Been coming here for along time now and i must say the customer service at the lounge from many different Bar Tenders over the years has always been on point. Sam, Thomas, Victor, Archie, Rosie do what they can to make you feel welcome in the Bar Lounge area and provide excellent customer service at all times.

I am leaving a complaint on your 6121 Westheimer location. I attempted to place an order through the Chili's app yesterday and I wanted to use my Penti Rewards points and the rest I wanted to pay in cash. Apparently though, I wasn't able to split payments through the app in that way. Once I got to the payment screen, I realized I couldn't pay half cash and use my points through the app, so I NEVER ONCE pressed the place order button, and never got the food. When I wake up this morning and check my account, i see 1400 of my Plenti points were taken even though i didn't actually place the order. The biggest problem is when I called the location to speak to them, The manager wouldn't give me his name and HE HUNG UP IN MY FACE!!! I am sure all of your calls are recorded. I called today around 1p.m. and I am sure you should be able to find the call. I am a fairly regular guest and I just wanted my points back. I will not dine at this location ever again. I love chili's and will never stop eating there, but NEVER AGAIN @ THAT LOCATION!!!!!

Service at bar needs improvement, bartender not very service oriented. Customer came in and sat at table in bar and had to wait awhile for service because server was finishing his opening duties at 11:45. Priorities need to be re evaluated. Food was pretty good.
Curbside is so easy and fast. The staff at this Chili's are always friendly and accommodating. The food is always good and the service is great.

This restaurant isn't bad. Sometimes my friend amanda & I come here. The staff is very nice and I like how they accommodate changes to a food dish if you want to substitute it with something els. Overall the atmosphere is good and the food is yummy!

My son and I came here for lunch in the bar area (my favorite area because of the TVs). We ordered extra crispy fries as an appetizer.. because I love fries! They were hot and fresh, just like I like em. For the entree we split a Santa Fe salad with grilled chicken. The Santa Fe sauce is the bomb. The split portion was perfect for us and we were satisfied. This is chili's so sometimes service is a hit or miss, but as long as the food is hot and fresh it's cool by me. There are definitely a lot of sucky chili's around Houston, but this one is one of the better ones and I will definitely return when I'm in the mood for this delish Salad.

Waited to be greeted and seated for 10 minutes. Not because it was busy just because no one wanted to be bothered. The bartender looked over at us and then away. The two waiters that were there saw us and continued about their business. We decided to wait around because maybe a hostess would eventually come. Finally, the kids got antsy enough and we decided to leave. As we walked out another party of 5 walked in. From the car we could see that they were sat within seconds. I called the manager to inform her of what just happen (i think her name was Tess.. started with a T) and she said, "I'm sorry that happened to you." That's all.  Never coming back here again :)
